result.execSummary:
The defendant David B. Barrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David B. Barrett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

11:35 a.m. Defendant David B. Barrett in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Schiek speaks to agreement/argue to sentencing. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek-compliance with victim rights/statement to sentencing/no objection to early discharge if restitution paid. 11:40 a.m. recess. 11:44 a.m. back on record, all parties present. Schiek statement. Cirilli/Barrett statement to sentencing. Court statement/if paid in full, early release motion can be made no earlier than 6 mos. Restitution to be paid through DA office. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Court sentence
WHS
1 yr. POP
Restitution $2,474.43 + 10% - TOTAL $2,721.87 - paid through DA office
CC/CV/Supervision
DNA surcharge
DNA sample
Appeal Rights
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:45 p.m. Attorney Nick G Cirilli in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli files authorization.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:02 p.m. Defendant David B. Barrett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has made offer - Defendant wanted attorney - applied at PD - not eligible - petition for court appointed attorney - denied - now would like time to seek private attorney. Adj. 2:03 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 2:11 p.m .Defendant David B. Barrett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will proceed own, waiver free and voluntary, Defendant pleads no contest. Michlig states no compliance with victim legislation. Defendant advised he can change his mind on representation. Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
